00083 /* Initialize the default settings for animation visualisation */
00084 void animviz_settings_init(bAnimVizSettings *avs)
00085 {
00086     /* sanity check */
00087     if (avs == NULL)
00088         return;
00089         
00090     /* ghosting settings */
00091     avs->ghost_bc= avs->ghost_ac= 10;
00092     
00093     avs->ghost_sf= 1; // xxx - take from scene instead?
00094     avs->ghost_ef= 250; // xxx - take from scene instead?
00095     
00096     avs->ghost_step= 1;
00097     
00098     
00099     /* path settings */
00100     avs->path_bc= avs->path_ac= 10;
00101     
00102     avs->path_sf= 1; // xxx - take from scene instead?
00103     avs->path_ef= 250; // xxx - take from scene instead?
00104     
00105     avs->path_viewflag= (MOTIONPATH_VIEW_KFRAS|MOTIONPATH_VIEW_KFNOS);
00106     
00107     avs->path_step= 1;
00108 }

00112 /* Free the given motion path's cache */
00113 void animviz_free_motionpath_cache(bMotionPath *mpath) 
00114 {
00115     /* sanity check */
00116     if (mpath == NULL) 
00117         return;
00118         
00119     /* free the path if necessary */
00120     if (mpath->points)
00121         MEM_freeN(mpath->points);
00122     
00123     /* reset the relevant parameters */
00124     mpath->points= NULL;
00125     mpath->length= 0;
00126 }
00127 
00128 /* Free the given motion path instance and its data 
00129  * NOTE: this frees the motion path given!
00130  */
00131 void animviz_free_motionpath(bMotionPath *mpath)
00132 {
00133     /* sanity check */
00134     if (mpath == NULL)
00135         return;
00136     
00137     /* free the cache first */
00138     animviz_free_motionpath_cache(mpath);
00139     
00140     /* now the instance itself */
00141     MEM_freeN(mpath);
00142 }

00146 /* Setup motion paths for the given data
00147  *  - scene: current scene (for frame ranges, etc.)
00148  *  - ob: object to add paths for (must be provided)
00149  *  - pchan: posechannel to add paths for (optional; if not provided, object-paths are assumed)
00150  */
00151 bMotionPath *animviz_verify_motionpaths(ReportList *reports, Scene *scene, Object *ob, bPoseChannel *pchan)
00152 {
00153     bAnimVizSettings *avs;
00154     bMotionPath *mpath, **dst;
00155     
00156     /* sanity checks */
00157     if (ELEM(NULL, scene, ob))
00158         return NULL;
00159         
00160     /* get destination data */
00161     if (pchan) {
00162         /* paths for posechannel - assume that posechannel belongs to the object */
00163         avs= &ob->pose->avs;
00164         dst= &pchan->mpath;
00165     }
00166     else {
00167         /* paths for object */
00168         avs= &ob->avs;
00169         dst= &ob->mpath;
00170     }
00171 
00172     /* avoid 0 size allocs */
00173     if (avs->path_sf >= avs->path_ef) {
00174         BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_ERROR,
00175                     "Motion Path frame extents invalid for %s (%d to %d).%s\n",
00176                     (pchan)? pchan->name : ob->id.name,
00177                     avs->path_sf, avs->path_ef,
00178                     (avs->path_sf == avs->path_ef)? " Cannot have single-frame paths." : "");
00179         return NULL;
00180     }
00181 
00182     /* if there is already a motionpath, just return that,
00183      * but provided it's settings are ok 
00184      */
00185     if (*dst != NULL) {
00186         mpath= *dst;
00187         
00188         /* if range is not invalid, and/or length is set ok, just return */
00189         if ((mpath->start_frame != mpath->end_frame) && (mpath->length > 0))
00190             return mpath;
00191     }
00192     else {
00193         /* create a new motionpath, and assign it */
00194         mpath= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bMotionPath), "bMotionPath");
00195         *dst= mpath;
00196     }
00197     
00198     /* set settings from the viz settings */
00199     mpath->start_frame= avs->path_sf;
00200     mpath->end_frame= avs->path_ef;
00201     
00202     mpath->length= mpath->end_frame - mpath->start_frame;
00203     
00204     if (avs->path_bakeflag & MOTIONPATH_BAKE_HEADS)
00205         mpath->flag |= MOTIONPATH_FLAG_BHEAD;
00206     else
00207         mpath->flag &= ~MOTIONPATH_FLAG_BHEAD;
00208     
00209     /* allocate a cache */
00210     mpath->points= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bMotionPathVert)*mpath->length, "bMotionPathVerts");
00211     
00212     /* tag viz settings as currently having some path(s) which use it */
00213     avs->path_bakeflag |= MOTIONPATH_BAKE_HAS_PATHS;
00214     
00215     /* return it */
00216     return mpath;
00217 }

00221 /* Motion path needing to be baked (mpt) */
00222 typedef struct MPathTarget {
00223     struct MPathTarget *next, *prev;
00224     
00225     bMotionPath *mpath;         /* motion path in question */
00226     
00227     Object *ob;                 /* source object */
00228     bPoseChannel *pchan;        /* source posechannel (if applicable) */
00229 } MPathTarget;

00233 /* get list of motion paths to be baked for the given object
00234  *  - assumes the given list is ready to be used
00235  */
00236 // TODO: it would be nice in future to be able to update objects dependent on these bones too?
00237 void animviz_get_object_motionpaths(Object *ob, ListBase *targets)
00238 {
00239     MPathTarget *mpt;
00240     
00241     /* object itself first */
00242     if ((ob->avs.recalc & ANIMVIZ_RECALC_PATHS) && (ob->mpath)) {
00243         /* new target for object */
00244         mpt= MEM_callocN(sizeof(MPathTarget), "MPathTarget Ob");
00245         BLI_addtail(targets, mpt);
00246         
00247         mpt->mpath= ob->mpath;
00248         mpt->ob= ob;
00249     }
00250     
00251     /* bones */
00252     if ((ob->pose) && (ob->pose->avs.recalc & ANIMVIZ_RECALC_PATHS)) {
00253         bArmature *arm= ob->data;
00254         bPoseChannel *pchan;
00255         
00256         for (pchan= ob->pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan= pchan->next) {
00257             if ((pchan->bone) && (arm->layer & pchan->bone->layer) && (pchan->mpath)) {
00258                 /* new target for bone */
00259                 mpt= MEM_callocN(sizeof(MPathTarget), "MPathTarget PoseBone");
00260                 BLI_addtail(targets, mpt);
00261                 
00262                 mpt->mpath= pchan->mpath;
00263                 mpt->ob= ob;
00264                 mpt->pchan= pchan;
00265             }
00266         }
00267     }
00268 }

00270 /* ........ */

00272 /* Note on evaluation optimisations:
00273  * Optimisations currently used here play tricks with the depsgraph in order to try and 
00274  * evaluate as few objects as strictly necessary to get nicer performance under standard
00275  * production conditions. For those people who really need the accurate version, 
00276  * disable the ifdef (i.e. 1 -> 0) and comment out the call to motionpaths_calc_optimise_depsgraph()
00277  */
00278 
00279 /* tweak the object ordering to trick depsgraph into making MotionPath calculations run faster */
00280 static void motionpaths_calc_optimise_depsgraph(Scene *scene, ListBase *targets)
00281 {
00282     Base *base, *baseNext;
00283     MPathTarget *mpt;
00284     
00285     /* make sure our temp-tag isn't already in use */
00286     for (base= scene->base.first; base; base= base->next)
00287         base->object->flag &= ~BA_TEMP_TAG;
00288     
00289     /* for each target, dump its object to the start of the list if it wasn't moved already */
00290     for (mpt= targets->first; mpt; mpt= mpt->next) {
00291         for (base=scene->base.first; base; base=baseNext) {
00292             baseNext = base->next;
00293             
00294             if ((base->object == mpt->ob) && !(mpt->ob->flag & BA_TEMP_TAG)) {
00295                 BLI_remlink(&scene->base, base);
00296                 BLI_addhead(&scene->base, base);
00297                 
00298                 mpt->ob->flag |= BA_TEMP_TAG;
00299                 break; // we really don't need to continue anymore once this happens, but this line might really 'break'
00300             }
00301         }
00302     }
00303     
00304     /* "brew me a list that's sorted a bit faster now depsy" */
00305     DAG_scene_sort(G.main, scene);
00306 }
00307 
00308 /* update scene for current frame */
00309 static void motionpaths_calc_update_scene(Scene *scene)
00310 {
00311 #if 1 // 'production' optimisations always on
00312     Base *base, *last=NULL;
00313     
00314     /* only stuff that moves or needs display still */
00315     DAG_scene_update_flags(G.main, scene, scene->lay, TRUE);
00316     
00317     /* find the last object with the tag 
00318      *  - all those afterwards are assumed to not be relevant for our calculations
00319      */
00320     // optimize further by moving out...
00321     for (base=scene->base.first; base; base=base->next) {
00322         if (base->object->flag & BA_TEMP_TAG)
00323             last = base;
00324     }
00325     
00326     /* perform updates for tagged objects */
00327     // XXX: this will break if rigs depend on scene or other data that 
00328     // is animated but not attached to/updatable from objects
00329     for (base=scene->base.first; base; base=base->next) {
00330         /* update this object */
00331         object_handle_update(scene, base->object);
00332         
00333         /* if this is the last one we need to update, let's stop to save some time */
00334         if (base == last)
00335             break;
00336     }
00337 #else // original, 'always correct' version
00338     /* do all updates 
00339      *  - if this is too slow, resort to using a more efficient way 
00340      *    that doesn't force complete update, but for now, this is the
00341      *    most accurate way!
00342      */
00343     scene_update_for_newframe(G.main, scene, scene->lay); // XXX this is the best way we can get anything moving
00344 #endif
00345 }
00346 
00347 /* ........ */
00348 
00349 /* perform baking for the targets on the current frame */
00350 static void motionpaths_calc_bake_targets(Scene *scene, ListBase *targets)
00351 {
00352     MPathTarget *mpt;
00353     
00354     /* for each target, check if it can be baked on the current frame */
00355     for (mpt= targets->first; mpt; mpt= mpt->next) {    
00356         bMotionPath *mpath= mpt->mpath;
00357         bMotionPathVert *mpv;
00358         
00359         /* current frame must be within the range the cache works for 
00360          *  - is inclusive of the first frame, but not the last otherwise we get buffer overruns
00361          */
00362         if ((CFRA < mpath->start_frame) || (CFRA >= mpath->end_frame))
00363             continue;
00364         
00365         /* get the relevant cache vert to write to */
00366         mpv= mpath->points + (CFRA - mpath->start_frame);
00367         
00368         /* pose-channel or object path baking? */
00369         if (mpt->pchan) {
00370             /* heads or tails */
00371             if (mpath->flag & MOTIONPATH_FLAG_BHEAD) {
00372                 copy_v3_v3(mpv->co, mpt->pchan->pose_head);
00373             }
00374             else {
00375                 copy_v3_v3(mpv->co, mpt->pchan->pose_tail);
00376             }
00377             
00378             /* result must be in worldspace */
00379             mul_m4_v3(mpt->ob->obmat, mpv->co);
00380         }
00381         else {
00382             /* worldspace object location */
00383             copy_v3_v3(mpv->co, mpt->ob->obmat[3]);
00384         }
00385     }
00386 }
00387 
00388 /* Perform baking of the given object's and/or its bones' transforms to motion paths 
00389  *  - scene: current scene
00390  *  - ob: object whose flagged motionpaths should get calculated
00391  *  - recalc: whether we need to 
00392  */
00393 // TODO: include reports pointer?
00394 void animviz_calc_motionpaths(Scene *scene, ListBase *targets)
00395 {
00396     MPathTarget *mpt;
00397     int sfra, efra;
00398     int cfra;
00399     
00400     /* sanity check */
00401     if (ELEM(NULL, targets, targets->first))
00402         return;
00403     
00404     /* set frame values */
00405     cfra = CFRA;
00406     sfra = efra = cfra;
00407     
00408     // TODO: this method could be improved...
00409     //  1) max range for standard baking
00410     //  2) minimum range for recalc baking (i.e. between keyframes, but how?)
00411     for (mpt= targets->first; mpt; mpt= mpt->next) {
00412         /* try to increase area to do (only as much as needed) */
00413         sfra= MIN2(sfra, mpt->mpath->start_frame);
00414         efra= MAX2(efra, mpt->mpath->end_frame);
00415     }
00416     if (efra <= sfra) return;
00417     
00418     /* optimize the depsgraph for faster updates */
00419     // TODO: whether this is used should depend on some setting for the level of optimisations used
00420     motionpaths_calc_optimise_depsgraph(scene, targets);
00421     
00422     /* calculate path over requested range */
00423     for (CFRA=sfra; CFRA<=efra; CFRA++) {
00424         /* update relevant data for new frame */
00425         motionpaths_calc_update_scene(scene);
00426         
00427         /* perform baking for targets */
00428         motionpaths_calc_bake_targets(scene, targets);
00429     }
00430     
00431     /* reset original environment */
00432     CFRA= cfra;
00433     motionpaths_calc_update_scene(scene);
00434     
00435     /* clear recalc flags from targets */
00436     for (mpt= targets->first; mpt; mpt= mpt->next) {
00437         bAnimVizSettings *avs;
00438         
00439         /* get pointer to animviz settings for each target */
00440         if (mpt->pchan)
00441             avs= &mpt->ob->pose->avs;
00442         else    
00443             avs= &mpt->ob->avs;
00444         
00445         /* clear the flag requesting recalculation of targets */
00446         avs->recalc &= ~ANIMVIZ_RECALC_PATHS;
00447     }
00448 }

00451 /* Curve Paths - for curve deforms and/or curve following */
00452 
00453 /* free curve path data 
00454  * NOTE: frees the path itself!
00455  * NOTE: this is increasingly inaccurate with non-uniform BevPoint subdivisions [#24633]
00456  */
00457 void free_path(Path *path)
00458 {
00459     if (path->data) MEM_freeN(path->data);
00460     MEM_freeN(path);
00461 }
00462 
00463 /* calculate a curve-deform path for a curve 
00464  *  - only called from displist.c -> do_makeDispListCurveTypes
00465  */
00466 void calc_curvepath(Object *ob)
00467 {
00468     BevList *bl;
00469     BevPoint *bevp, *bevpn, *bevpfirst, *bevplast;
00470     PathPoint *pp;
00471     Curve *cu;
00472     Nurb *nu;
00473     Path *path;
00474     float *fp, *dist, *maxdist, xyz[3];
00475     float fac, d=0, fac1, fac2;
00476     int a, tot, cycl=0;
00477     ListBase *nurbs;
00478     
00479     /* in a path vertices are with equal differences: path->len = number of verts */
00480     /* NOW WITH BEVELCURVE!!! */
00481     
00482     if (ob==NULL || ob->type != OB_CURVE) return;
00483     cu= ob->data;
00484 
00485     nurbs= BKE_curve_nurbs(cu);
00486     nu= nurbs->first;
00487 
00488     if (cu->path) free_path(cu->path);
00489     cu->path= NULL;
00490     
00491     bl= cu->bev.first;
00492     if (bl==NULL || !bl->nr) return;
00493 
00494     cu->path=path= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Path), "calc_curvepath");
00495     
00496     /* if POLY: last vertice != first vertice */
00497     cycl= (bl->poly!= -1);
00498     
00499     if (cycl) tot= bl->nr;
00500     else tot= bl->nr-1;
00501     
00502     path->len= tot+1;
00503     /* exception: vector handle paths and polygon paths should be subdivided at least a factor resolu */
00504     if (path->len<nu->resolu*SEGMENTSU(nu)) path->len= nu->resolu*SEGMENTSU(nu);
00505     
00506     dist= (float *)MEM_mallocN((tot+1)*4, "calcpathdist");
00507 
00508         /* all lengths in *dist */
00509     bevp= bevpfirst= (BevPoint *)(bl+1);
00510     fp= dist;
00511     *fp= 0;
00512     for (a=0; a<tot; a++) {
00513         fp++;
00514         if (cycl && a==tot-1)
00515             sub_v3_v3v3(xyz, bevpfirst->vec, bevp->vec);
00516         else
00517             sub_v3_v3v3(xyz, (bevp+1)->vec, bevp->vec);
00518         
00519         *fp= *(fp-1)+len_v3(xyz);
00520         bevp++;
00521     }
00522     
00523     path->totdist= *fp;
00524     
00525         /* the path verts  in path->data */
00526         /* now also with TILT value */
00527     pp= path->data = (PathPoint *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(PathPoint)*path->len, "pathdata");
00528     
00529     bevp= bevpfirst;
00530     bevpn= bevp+1;
00531     bevplast= bevpfirst + (bl->nr-1);
00532     fp= dist+1;
00533     maxdist= dist+tot;
00534     fac= 1.0f/((float)path->len-1.0f);
00535         fac = fac * path->totdist;
00536     
00537     for (a=0; a<path->len; a++) {
00538         
00539         d= ((float)a)*fac;
00540         
00541         /* we're looking for location (distance) 'd' in the array */
00542         while ((d>= *fp) && fp<maxdist) {
00543             fp++;
00544             if (bevp<bevplast) bevp++;
00545             bevpn= bevp+1;
00546             if (bevpn>bevplast) {
00547                 if (cycl) bevpn= bevpfirst;
00548                 else bevpn= bevplast;
00549             }
00550         }
00551         
00552         fac1= *(fp)- *(fp-1);
00553         fac2= *(fp)-d;
00554         fac1= fac2/fac1;
00555         fac2= 1.0f-fac1;
00556         
00557         interp_v3_v3v3(pp->vec, bevp->vec, bevpn->vec, fac2);
00558         pp->vec[3]= fac1*bevp->alfa + fac2*bevpn->alfa;
00559         pp->radius= fac1*bevp->radius + fac2*bevpn->radius;
00560         pp->weight= fac1*bevp->weight + fac2*bevpn->weight;
00561         interp_qt_qtqt(pp->quat, bevp->quat, bevpn->quat, fac2);
00562         normalize_qt(pp->quat);
00563         
00564         pp++;
00565     }
00566     
00567     MEM_freeN(dist);
00568 }

00570 
00571 /* is this only used internally?*/
00572 int interval_test(int min, int max, int p1, int cycl)
00573 {
00574     if (cycl) {
00575         if (p1 < min) 
00576             p1=  ((p1 -min) % (max-min+1)) + max+1;
00577         else if (p1 > max)
00578             p1=  ((p1 -min) % (max-min+1)) + min;
00579     }
00580     else {
00581         if (p1 < min) p1= min;
00582         else if (p1 > max) p1= max;
00583     }
00584     return p1;
00585 }

00587 
00588 /* calculate the deformation implied by the curve path at a given parametric position,
00589  * and returns whether this operation succeeded.
00590  *
00591  * note: ctime is normalized range <0-1>
00592  *
00593  * returns OK: 1/0
00594  */
00595 int where_on_path(Object *ob, float ctime, float vec[4], float dir[3], float quat[4], float *radius, float *weight)
00596 {
00597     Curve *cu;
00598     Nurb *nu;
00599     BevList *bl;
00600     Path *path;
00601     PathPoint *pp, *p0, *p1, *p2, *p3;
00602     float fac;
00603     float data[4];
00604     int cycl=0, s0, s1, s2, s3;
00605 
00606     if (ob==NULL || ob->type != OB_CURVE) return 0;
00607     cu= ob->data;
00608     if (cu->path==NULL || cu->path->data==NULL) {
00609         printf("no path!\n");
00610         return 0;
00611     }
00612     path= cu->path;
00613     pp= path->data;
00614     
00615     /* test for cyclic */
00616     bl= cu->bev.first;
00617     if (!bl) return 0;
00618     if (!bl->nr) return 0;
00619     if (bl->poly> -1) cycl= 1;
00620 
00621     ctime *= (path->len-1);
00622     
00623     s1= (int)floor(ctime);
00624     fac= (float)(s1+1)-ctime;
00625 
00626     /* path->len is corected for cyclic */
00627     s0= interval_test(0, path->len-1-cycl, s1-1, cycl);
00628     s1= interval_test(0, path->len-1-cycl, s1, cycl);
00629     s2= interval_test(0, path->len-1-cycl, s1+1, cycl);
00630     s3= interval_test(0, path->len-1-cycl, s1+2, cycl);
00631 
00632     p0= pp + s0;
00633     p1= pp + s1;
00634     p2= pp + s2;
00635     p3= pp + s3;
00636 
00637     /* note, commented out for follow constraint */
00638     //if (cu->flag & CU_FOLLOW) {
00639 
00640         key_curve_tangent_weights(1.0f-fac, data, KEY_BSPLINE);
00641 
00642         interp_v3_v3v3v3v3(dir, p0->vec, p1->vec, p2->vec, p3->vec, data);
00643 
00644         /* make compatible with vectoquat */
00645         negate_v3(dir);
00646     //}
00647     
00648     nu= cu->nurb.first;
00649 
00650     /* make sure that first and last frame are included in the vectors here  */
00651     if (nu->type == CU_POLY) key_curve_position_weights(1.0f-fac, data, KEY_LINEAR);
00652     else if (nu->type == CU_BEZIER) key_curve_position_weights(1.0f-fac, data, KEY_LINEAR);
00653     else if (s0==s1 || p2==p3) key_curve_position_weights(1.0f-fac, data, KEY_CARDINAL);
00654     else key_curve_position_weights(1.0f-fac, data, KEY_BSPLINE);
00655 
00656     vec[0]= data[0]*p0->vec[0] + data[1]*p1->vec[0] + data[2]*p2->vec[0] + data[3]*p3->vec[0] ; /* X */
00657     vec[1]= data[0]*p0->vec[1] + data[1]*p1->vec[1] + data[2]*p2->vec[1] + data[3]*p3->vec[1] ; /* Y */
00658     vec[2]= data[0]*p0->vec[2] + data[1]*p1->vec[2] + data[2]*p2->vec[2] + data[3]*p3->vec[2] ; /* Z */
00659     vec[3]= data[0]*p0->vec[3] + data[1]*p1->vec[3] + data[2]*p2->vec[3] + data[3]*p3->vec[3] ; /* Tilt, should not be needed since we have quat still used */
00660 
00661     if (quat) {
00662         float totfac, q1[4], q2[4];
00663 
00664         totfac= data[0]+data[3];
00665         if (totfac>FLT_EPSILON) interp_qt_qtqt(q1, p0->quat, p3->quat, data[3] / totfac);
00666         else                    copy_qt_qt(q1, p1->quat);
00667 
00668         totfac= data[1]+data[2];
00669         if (totfac>FLT_EPSILON) interp_qt_qtqt(q2, p1->quat, p2->quat, data[2] / totfac);
00670         else                    copy_qt_qt(q2, p3->quat);
00671 
00672         totfac = data[0]+data[1]+data[2]+data[3];
00673         if (totfac>FLT_EPSILON) interp_qt_qtqt(quat, q1, q2, (data[1]+data[2]) / totfac);
00674         else                    copy_qt_qt(quat, q2);
00675     }
00676 
00677     if (radius)
00678         *radius= data[0]*p0->radius + data[1]*p1->radius + data[2]*p2->radius + data[3]*p3->radius;
00679 
00680     if (weight)
00681         *weight= data[0]*p0->weight + data[1]*p1->weight + data[2]*p2->weight + data[3]*p3->weight;
00682 
00683     return 1;
00684 }
00685 
00686 /* ******************************************************************** */
00687 /* Dupli-Geometry */
00688 
00689 static DupliObject *new_dupli_object(ListBase *lb, Object *ob, float mat[][4], int lay, int index, int type, int animated)
00690 {
00691     DupliObject *dob= MEM_callocN(sizeof(DupliObject), "dupliobject");
00692     
00693     BLI_addtail(lb, dob);
00694     dob->ob= ob;
00695     copy_m4_m4(dob->mat, mat);
00696     copy_m4_m4(dob->omat, ob->obmat);
00697     dob->origlay= ob->lay;
00698     dob->index= index;
00699     dob->type= type;
00700     dob->animated= (type == OB_DUPLIGROUP) && animated;
00701     ob->lay= lay;
00702     
00703     return dob;
00704 }
00705 
00706 static void group_duplilist(ListBase *lb, Scene *scene, Object *ob, int level, int animated)
00707 {
00708     DupliObject *dob;
00709     Group *group;
00710     GroupObject *go;
00711     float mat[4][4], tmat[4][4];
00712     
00713     if (ob->dup_group==NULL) return;
00714     group= ob->dup_group;
00715     
00716     /* simple preventing of too deep nested groups */
00717     if (level>MAX_DUPLI_RECUR) return;
00718     
00719     /* handles animated groups, and */
00720     /* we need to check update for objects that are not in scene... */
00721     group_handle_recalc_and_update(scene, ob, group);
00722     animated= animated || group_is_animated(ob, group);
00723     
00724     for (go= group->gobject.first; go; go= go->next) {
00725         /* note, if you check on layer here, render goes wrong... it still deforms verts and uses parent imat */
00726         if (go->ob!=ob) {
00727             
00728             /* group dupli offset, should apply after everything else */
00729             if (!is_zero_v3(group->dupli_ofs)) {
00730                 copy_m4_m4(tmat, go->ob->obmat);
00731                 sub_v3_v3v3(tmat[3], tmat[3], group->dupli_ofs);
00732                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, ob->obmat, tmat);
00733             }
00734             else {
00735                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, ob->obmat, go->ob->obmat);
00736             }
00737             
00738             dob= new_dupli_object(lb, go->ob, mat, ob->lay, 0, OB_DUPLIGROUP, animated);
00739 
00740             /* check the group instance and object layers match, also that the object visible flags are ok. */
00741             if (    (dob->origlay & group->layer)==0 ||
00742                 (G.rendering==0 && dob->ob->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_VIEW) ||
00743                 (G.rendering && dob->ob->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_RENDER)
00744             ) {
00745                 dob->no_draw= 1;
00746             }
00747             else {
00748                 dob->no_draw= 0;
00749             }
00750 
00751             if (go->ob->transflag & OB_DUPLI) {
00752                 copy_m4_m4(dob->ob->obmat, dob->mat);
00753                 object_duplilist_recursive(&group->id, scene, go->ob, lb, ob->obmat, level+1, animated);
00754                 copy_m4_m4(dob->ob->obmat, dob->omat);
00755             }
00756         }
00757     }
00758 }
00759 
00760 static void frames_duplilist(ListBase *lb, Scene *scene, Object *ob, int level, int animated)
00761 {
00762     extern int enable_cu_speed; /* object.c */
00763     Object copyob;
00764     int cfrao = scene->r.cfra;
00765     int dupend = ob->dupend;
00766     
00767     /* simple prevention of too deep nested groups */
00768     if (level > MAX_DUPLI_RECUR) return;
00769     
00770     /* if we don't have any data/settings which will lead to object movement,
00771      * don't waste time trying, as it will all look the same...
00772      */
00773     if (ob->parent==NULL && ob->constraints.first==NULL && ob->adt==NULL) 
00774         return;
00775     
00776     /* make a copy of the object's original data (before any dupli-data overwrites it) 
00777      * as we'll need this to keep track of unkeyed data
00778      *  - this doesn't take into account other data that can be reached from the object,
00779      *    for example it's shapekeys or bones, hence the need for an update flush at the end
00780      */
00781     copyob = *ob;
00782     
00783     /* duplicate over the required range */
00784     if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLINOSPEED) enable_cu_speed= 0;
00785     
00786     for (scene->r.cfra= ob->dupsta; scene->r.cfra<=dupend; scene->r.cfra++) {
00787         short ok= 1;
00788         
00789         /* - dupoff = how often a frames within the range shouldn't be made into duplis
00790          * - dupon = the length of each "skipping" block in frames
00791          */
00792         if (ob->dupoff) {
00793             ok= scene->r.cfra - ob->dupsta;
00794             ok= ok % (ob->dupon+ob->dupoff);
00795             ok= (ok < ob->dupon);
00796         }
00797         
00798         if (ok) {   
00799             DupliObject *dob;
00800             
00801             /* WARNING: doing animation updates in this way is not terribly accurate, as the dependencies
00802              * and/or other objects which may affect this object's transforms are not updated either.
00803              * However, this has always been the way that this worked (i.e. pre 2.5), so I guess that it'll be fine!
00804              */
00805             BKE_animsys_evaluate_animdata(scene, &ob->id, ob->adt, (float)scene->r.cfra, ADT_RECALC_ANIM); /* ob-eval will do drivers, so we don't need to do them */
00806             where_is_object_time(scene, ob, (float)scene->r.cfra);
00807             
00808             dob= new_dupli_object(lb, ob, ob->obmat, ob->lay, scene->r.cfra, OB_DUPLIFRAMES, animated);
00809             copy_m4_m4(dob->omat, copyob.obmat);
00810         }
00811     }
00812 
00813     enable_cu_speed= 1;
00814     
00815     /* reset frame to original frame, then re-evaluate animation as above 
00816      * as 2.5 animation data may have far-reaching consequences
00817      */
00818     scene->r.cfra= cfrao;
00819     
00820     BKE_animsys_evaluate_animdata(scene, &ob->id, ob->adt, (float)scene->r.cfra, ADT_RECALC_ANIM); /* ob-eval will do drivers, so we don't need to do them */
00821     where_is_object_time(scene, ob, (float)scene->r.cfra);
00822     
00823     /* but, to make sure unkeyed object transforms are still sane, 
00824      * let's copy object's original data back over
00825      */
00826     *ob = copyob;
00827 }
00828 
00829 typedef struct vertexDupliData {
00830     ID *id; /* scene or group, for recursive loops */
00831     int level;
00832     int animated;
00833     ListBase *lb;
00834     float pmat[4][4];
00835     float obmat[4][4]; /* Only used for dupliverts inside dupligroups, where the ob->obmat is modified */
00836     Scene *scene;
00837     Object *ob, *par;
00838     float (*orco)[3];
00839 } vertexDupliData;
00840 
00841 /* ------------- */
00842 
00843 static void vertex_dupli__mapFunc(void *userData, int index, const float co[3],
00844                                   const float no_f[3], const short no_s[3])
00845 {
00846     DupliObject *dob;
00847     vertexDupliData *vdd= userData;
00848     float vec[3], q2[4], mat[3][3], tmat[4][4], obmat[4][4];
00849     int origlay;
00850     
00851     mul_v3_m4v3(vec, vdd->pmat, co);
00852     sub_v3_v3(vec, vdd->pmat[3]);
00853     add_v3_v3(vec, vdd->obmat[3]);
00854     
00855     copy_m4_m4(obmat, vdd->obmat);
00856     copy_v3_v3(obmat[3], vec);
00857     
00858     if (vdd->par->transflag & OB_DUPLIROT) {
00859         if (no_f) {
00860             vec[0]= -no_f[0]; vec[1]= -no_f[1]; vec[2]= -no_f[2];
00861         }
00862         else if (no_s) {
00863             vec[0]= -no_s[0]; vec[1]= -no_s[1]; vec[2]= -no_s[2];
00864         }
00865         
00866         vec_to_quat( q2,vec, vdd->ob->trackflag, vdd->ob->upflag);
00867         
00868         quat_to_mat3( mat,q2);
00869         copy_m4_m4(tmat, obmat);
00870         mul_m4_m4m3(obmat, tmat, mat);
00871     }
00872 
00873     origlay = vdd->ob->lay;
00874     
00875     dob= new_dupli_object(vdd->lb, vdd->ob, obmat, vdd->par->lay, index, OB_DUPLIVERTS, vdd->animated);
00876 
00877     /* restore the original layer so that each dupli will have proper dob->origlay */
00878     vdd->ob->lay = origlay;
00879 
00880     if (vdd->orco)
00881         copy_v3_v3(dob->orco, vdd->orco[index]);
00882     
00883     if (vdd->ob->transflag & OB_DUPLI) {
00884         float tmpmat[4][4];
00885         copy_m4_m4(tmpmat, vdd->ob->obmat);
00886         copy_m4_m4(vdd->ob->obmat, obmat); /* pretend we are really this mat */
00887         object_duplilist_recursive((ID *)vdd->id, vdd->scene, vdd->ob, vdd->lb, obmat, vdd->level+1, vdd->animated);
00888         copy_m4_m4(vdd->ob->obmat, tmpmat);
00889     }
00890 }
00891 
00892 static void vertex_duplilist(ListBase *lb, ID *id, Scene *scene, Object *par, float par_space_mat[][4], int level, int animated)
00893 {
00894     Object *ob, *ob_iter;
00895     Mesh *me= par->data;
00896     Base *base = NULL;
00897     DerivedMesh *dm;
00898     vertexDupliData vdd;
00899     Scene *sce = NULL;
00900     Group *group = NULL;
00901     GroupObject * go = NULL;
00902     BMEditMesh *em;
00903     float vec[3], no[3], pmat[4][4];
00904     int totvert, a, oblay;
00905     unsigned int lay;
00906     
00907     copy_m4_m4(pmat, par->obmat);
00908     
00909     /* simple preventing of too deep nested groups */
00910     if (level>MAX_DUPLI_RECUR) return;
00911     
00912     em = me->edit_btmesh;
00913     
00914     if (em) {
00915         dm= editbmesh_get_derived_cage(scene, par, em, CD_MASK_BAREMESH);
00916     }
00917     else
00918         dm= mesh_get_derived_deform(scene, par, CD_MASK_BAREMESH);
00919     
00920     if (G.rendering) {
00921         vdd.orco= (float(*)[3])get_mesh_orco_verts(par);
00922         transform_mesh_orco_verts(me, vdd.orco, me->totvert, 0);
00923     }
00924     else
00925         vdd.orco= NULL;
00926     
00927     totvert = dm->getNumVerts(dm);
00928 
00929     /* having to loop on scene OR group objects is NOT FUN */
00930     if (GS(id->name) == ID_SCE) {
00931         sce = (Scene *)id;
00932         lay= sce->lay;
00933         base= sce->base.first;
00934     }
00935     else {
00936         group = (Group *)id;
00937         lay= group->layer;
00938         go = group->gobject.first;
00939     }
00940     
00941     /* Start looping on Scene OR Group objects */
00942     while (base || go) { 
00943         if (sce) {
00944             ob_iter= base->object;
00945             oblay = base->lay;
00946         }
00947         else {
00948             ob_iter= go->ob;
00949             oblay = ob_iter->lay;
00950         }
00951         
00952         if (lay & oblay && scene->obedit!=ob_iter) {
00953             ob=ob_iter->parent;
00954             while (ob) {
00955                 if (ob==par) {
00956                     ob = ob_iter;
00957     /* End Scene/Group object loop, below is generic */
00958                     
00959                     
00960                     /* par_space_mat - only used for groups so we can modify the space dupli's are in
00961                      * when par_space_mat is NULL ob->obmat can be used instead of ob__obmat
00962                      */
00963                     if (par_space_mat)
00964                         mult_m4_m4m4(vdd.obmat, par_space_mat, ob->obmat);
00965                     else
00966                         copy_m4_m4(vdd.obmat, ob->obmat);
00967 
00968                     vdd.id= id;
00969                     vdd.level= level;
00970                     vdd.animated= animated;
00971                     vdd.lb= lb;
00972                     vdd.ob= ob;
00973                     vdd.scene= scene;
00974                     vdd.par= par;
00975                     copy_m4_m4(vdd.pmat, pmat);
00976                     
00977                     /* mballs have a different dupli handling */
00978                     if (ob->type!=OB_MBALL) ob->flag |= OB_DONE;    /* doesnt render */
00979 
00980                     if (me->edit_btmesh) {
00981                         dm->foreachMappedVert(dm, vertex_dupli__mapFunc, (void*) &vdd);
00982                     }
00983                     else {
00984                         for (a=0; a<totvert; a++) {
00985                             dm->getVertCo(dm, a, vec);
00986                             dm->getVertNo(dm, a, no);
00987                             
00988                             vertex_dupli__mapFunc(&vdd, a, vec, no, NULL);
00989                         }
00990                     }
00991                     if (sce) {
00992                         /* Set proper layer in case of scene looping,
00993                          * in case of groups the object layer will be
00994                          * changed when it's duplicated due to the
00995                          * group duplication.
00996                          */
00997                         ob->lay = vdd.par->lay;
00998                     }
00999                     
01000                     break;
01001                 }
01002                 ob= ob->parent;
01003             }
01004         }
01005         if (sce)    base= base->next;   /* scene loop */
01006         else        go= go->next;       /* group loop */
01007     }
01008 
01009     if (vdd.orco)
01010         MEM_freeN(vdd.orco);
01011     dm->release(dm);
01012 }
01013 
01014 static void face_duplilist(ListBase *lb, ID *id, Scene *scene, Object *par, float par_space_mat[][4], int level, int animated)
01015 {
01016     Object *ob, *ob_iter;
01017     Base *base = NULL;
01018     DupliObject *dob;
01019     DerivedMesh *dm;
01020     Mesh *me= par->data;
01021     MLoopUV *mloopuv;
01022     MPoly *mpoly, *mp;
01023     MLoop *mloop;
01024     MVert *mvert;
01025     float pmat[4][4], imat[3][3], (*orco)[3] = NULL, w;
01026     int lay, oblay, totface, a;
01027     Scene *sce = NULL;
01028     Group *group = NULL;
01029     GroupObject *go = NULL;
01030     BMEditMesh *em;
01031     float ob__obmat[4][4]; /* needed for groups where the object matrix needs to be modified */
01032     
01033     /* simple preventing of too deep nested groups */
01034     if (level>MAX_DUPLI_RECUR) return;
01035     
01036     copy_m4_m4(pmat, par->obmat);
01037     em = me->edit_btmesh;
01038 
01039     if (em) {
01040         dm= editbmesh_get_derived_cage(scene, par, em, CD_MASK_BAREMESH);
01041     }
01042     else {
01043         dm = mesh_get_derived_deform(scene, par, CD_MASK_BAREMESH);
01044     }
01045 
01046     totface= dm->getNumPolys(dm);
01047     mpoly= dm->getPolyArray(dm);
01048     mloop= dm->getLoopArray(dm);
01049     mvert= dm->getVertArray(dm);
01050 
01051     if (G.rendering) {
01052 
01053         orco= (float(*)[3])get_mesh_orco_verts(par);
01054         transform_mesh_orco_verts(me, orco, me->totvert, 0);
01055         mloopuv= me->mloopuv;
01056     }
01057     else {
01058         orco= NULL;
01059         mloopuv= NULL;
01060     }
01061     
01062     /* having to loop on scene OR group objects is NOT FUN */
01063     if (GS(id->name) == ID_SCE) {
01064         sce = (Scene *)id;
01065         lay= sce->lay;
01066         base= sce->base.first;
01067     }
01068     else {
01069         group = (Group *)id;
01070         lay= group->layer;
01071         go = group->gobject.first;
01072     }
01073     
01074     /* Start looping on Scene OR Group objects */
01075     while (base || go) { 
01076         if (sce) {
01077             ob_iter= base->object;
01078             oblay = base->lay;
01079         }
01080         else {
01081             ob_iter= go->ob;
01082             oblay = ob_iter->lay;
01083         }
01084         
01085         if (lay & oblay && scene->obedit!=ob_iter) {
01086             ob=ob_iter->parent;
01087             while (ob) {
01088                 if (ob==par) {
01089                     ob = ob_iter;
01090     /* End Scene/Group object loop, below is generic */
01091                     
01092                     /* par_space_mat - only used for groups so we can modify the space dupli's are in
01093                      * when par_space_mat is NULL ob->obmat can be used instead of ob__obmat
01094                      */
01095                     if (par_space_mat)
01096                         mult_m4_m4m4(ob__obmat, par_space_mat, ob->obmat);
01097                     else
01098                         copy_m4_m4(ob__obmat, ob->obmat);
01099                     
01100                     copy_m3_m4(imat, ob->parentinv);
01101                         
01102                     /* mballs have a different dupli handling */
01103                     if (ob->type!=OB_MBALL) ob->flag |= OB_DONE;    /* doesnt render */
01104 
01105                     for (a=0, mp= mpoly; a<totface; a++, mp++) {
01106                         int mv1;
01107                         int mv2;
01108                         int mv3;
01109                         /* int mv4; */ /* UNUSED */
01110                         float *v1;
01111                         float *v2;
01112                         float *v3;
01113                         /* float *v4; */ /* UNUSED */
01114                         float cent[3], quat[4], mat[3][3], mat3[3][3], tmat[4][4], obmat[4][4];
01115                         MLoop *loopstart= mloop + mp->loopstart;
01116 
01117                         if (mp->totloop < 3) {
01118                             /* highly unlikely but to be safe */
01119                             continue;
01120                         }
01121                         else {
01122                             v1= mvert[(mv1= loopstart[0].v)].co;
01123                             v2= mvert[(mv2= loopstart[1].v)].co;
01124                             v3= mvert[(mv3= loopstart[2].v)].co;
01125 #if 0
01126                             if (mp->totloop > 3) {
01127                                 v4= mvert[(mv4= loopstart[3].v)].co;
01128                             }
01129 #endif
01130                         }
01131 
01132                         /* translation */
01133                         mesh_calc_poly_center(mp, loopstart, mvert, cent);
01134 
01135                         mul_m4_v3(pmat, cent);
01136                         
01137                         sub_v3_v3v3(cent, cent, pmat[3]);
01138                         add_v3_v3(cent, ob__obmat[3]);
01139                         
01140                         copy_m4_m4(obmat, ob__obmat);
01141                         
01142                         copy_v3_v3(obmat[3], cent);
01143                         
01144                         /* rotation */
01145                         tri_to_quat( quat,v1, v2, v3);
01146                         quat_to_mat3( mat,quat);
01147                         
01148                         /* scale */
01149                         if (par->transflag & OB_DUPLIFACES_SCALE) {
01150                             float size= mesh_calc_poly_area(mp, loopstart, mvert, NULL);
01151                             size= sqrtf(size) * par->dupfacesca;
01152                             mul_m3_fl(mat, size);
01153                         }
01154                         
01155                         copy_m3_m3(mat3, mat);
01156                         mul_m3_m3m3(mat, imat, mat3);
01157                         
01158                         copy_m4_m4(tmat, obmat);
01159                         mul_m4_m4m3(obmat, tmat, mat);
01160                         
01161                         dob= new_dupli_object(lb, ob, obmat, par->lay, a, OB_DUPLIFACES, animated);
01162                         if (G.rendering) {
01163                             w= 1.0f / (float)mp->totloop;
01164 
01165                             if (orco) {
01166                                 int j;
01167                                 for (j = 0; j < mpoly->totloop; j++) {
01168                                     madd_v3_v3fl(dob->orco, orco[loopstart[j].v], w);
01169                                 }
01170                             }
01171 
01172                             if (mloopuv) {
01173                                 int j;
01174                                 for (j = 0; j < mpoly->totloop; j++) {
01175                                     madd_v2_v2fl(dob->orco, mloopuv[loopstart[j].v].uv, w);
01176                                 }
01177                             }
01178                         }
01179                         
01180                         if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLI) {
01181                             float tmpmat[4][4];
01182                             copy_m4_m4(tmpmat, ob->obmat);
01183                             copy_m4_m4(ob->obmat, obmat); /* pretend we are really this mat */
01184                             object_duplilist_recursive((ID *)id, scene, ob, lb, ob->obmat, level+1, animated);
01185                             copy_m4_m4(ob->obmat, tmpmat);
01186                         }
01187                     }
01188                     
01189                     break;
01190                 }
01191                 ob= ob->parent;
01192             }
01193         }
01194         if (sce)    base= base->next;   /* scene loop */
01195         else        go= go->next;       /* group loop */
01196     }
01197 
01198     if (orco)
01199         MEM_freeN(orco);
01200     
01201     dm->release(dm);
01202 }
01203 
01204 static void new_particle_duplilist(ListBase *lb, ID *id, Scene *scene, Object *par, float par_space_mat[][4], ParticleSystem *psys, int level, int animated)
01205 {
01206     GroupObject *go;
01207     Object *ob=NULL, **oblist=NULL, obcopy, *obcopylist=NULL;
01208     DupliObject *dob;
01209     ParticleDupliWeight *dw;
01210     ParticleSettings *part;
01211     ParticleData *pa;
01212     ChildParticle *cpa=NULL;
01213     ParticleKey state;
01214     ParticleCacheKey *cache;
01215     float ctime, pa_time, scale = 1.0f;
01216     float tmat[4][4], mat[4][4], pamat[4][4], vec[3], size=0.0;
01217     float (*obmat)[4], (*oldobmat)[4];
01218     int a, b, counter, hair = 0;
01219     int totpart, totchild, totgroup=0 /*, pa_num */;
01220 
01221     int no_draw_flag = PARS_UNEXIST;
01222 
01223     if (psys==NULL) return;
01224     
01225     /* simple preventing of too deep nested groups */
01226     if (level>MAX_DUPLI_RECUR) return;
01227     
01228     part=psys->part;
01229 
01230     if (part==NULL)
01231         return;
01232 
01233     if (!psys_check_enabled(par, psys))
01234         return;
01235 
01236     if (G.rendering == 0)
01237         no_draw_flag |= PARS_NO_DISP;
01238     
01239     ctime = BKE_curframe(scene); /* NOTE: in old animsys, used parent object's timeoffset... */
01240 
01241     totpart = psys->totpart;
01242     totchild = psys->totchild;
01243 
01244     BLI_srandom(31415926 + psys->seed);
01245 
01246     if ((psys->renderdata || part->draw_as==PART_DRAW_REND) && ELEM(part->ren_as, PART_DRAW_OB, PART_DRAW_GR)) {
01247         ParticleSimulationData sim= {NULL};
01248         sim.scene= scene;
01249         sim.ob= par;
01250         sim.psys= psys;
01251         sim.psmd= psys_get_modifier(par, psys);
01252         /* make sure emitter imat is in global coordinates instead of render view coordinates */
01253         invert_m4_m4(par->imat, par->obmat);
01254 
01255         /* first check for loops (particle system object used as dupli object) */
01256         if (part->ren_as == PART_DRAW_OB) {
01257             if (ELEM(part->dup_ob, NULL, par))
01258                 return;
01259         }
01260         else { /*PART_DRAW_GR */
01261             if (part->dup_group == NULL || part->dup_group->gobject.first == NULL)
01262                 return;
01263 
01264             for (go=part->dup_group->gobject.first; go; go=go->next)
01265                 if (go->ob == par)
01266                     return;
01267         }
01268 
01269         /* if we have a hair particle system, use the path cache */
01270         if (part->type == PART_HAIR) {
01271             if (psys->flag & PSYS_HAIR_DONE)
01272                 hair= (totchild == 0 || psys->childcache) && psys->pathcache;
01273             if (!hair)
01274                 return;
01275             
01276             /* we use cache, update totchild according to cached data */
01277             totchild = psys->totchildcache;
01278             totpart = psys->totcached;
01279         }
01280 
01281         psys_check_group_weights(part);
01282 
01283         psys->lattice = psys_get_lattice(&sim);
01284 
01285         /* gather list of objects or single object */
01286         if (part->ren_as==PART_DRAW_GR) {
01287             group_handle_recalc_and_update(scene, par, part->dup_group);
01288 
01289             if (part->draw & PART_DRAW_COUNT_GR) {
01290                 for (dw=part->dupliweights.first; dw; dw=dw->next)
01291                     totgroup += dw->count;
01292             }
01293             else {
01294                 for (go=part->dup_group->gobject.first; go; go=go->next)
01295                     totgroup++;
01296             }
01297 
01298             /* we also copy the actual objects to restore afterwards, since
01299              * where_is_object_time will change the object which breaks transform */
01300             oblist = MEM_callocN(totgroup*sizeof(Object *), "dupgroup object list");
01301             obcopylist = MEM_callocN(totgroup*sizeof(Object), "dupgroup copy list");
01302 
01303             
01304             if (part->draw & PART_DRAW_COUNT_GR && totgroup) {
01305                 dw = part->dupliweights.first;
01306 
01307                 for (a=0; a<totgroup; dw=dw->next) {
01308                     for (b=0; b<dw->count; b++, a++) {
01309                         oblist[a] = dw->ob;
01310                         obcopylist[a] = *dw->ob;
01311                     }
01312                 }
01313             }
01314             else {
01315                 go = part->dup_group->gobject.first;
01316                 for (a=0; a<totgroup; a++, go=go->next) {
01317                     oblist[a] = go->ob;
01318                     obcopylist[a] = *go->ob;
01319                 }
01320             }
01321         }
01322         else {
01323             ob = part->dup_ob;
01324             obcopy = *ob;
01325         }
01326 
01327         if (totchild==0 || part->draw & PART_DRAW_PARENT)
01328             a = 0;
01329         else
01330             a = totpart;
01331 
01332         for (pa=psys->particles,counter=0; a<totpart+totchild; a++,pa++,counter++) {
01333             if (a<totpart) {
01334                 /* handle parent particle */
01335                 if (pa->flag & no_draw_flag)
01336                     continue;
01337 
01338                 /* pa_num = pa->num; */ /* UNUSED */
01339                 pa_time = pa->time;
01340                 size = pa->size;
01341             }
01342             else {
01343                 /* handle child particle */
01344                 cpa = &psys->child[a - totpart];
01345 
01346                 /* pa_num = a; */ /* UNUSED */
01347                 pa_time = psys->particles[cpa->parent].time;
01348                 size = psys_get_child_size(psys, cpa, ctime, NULL);
01349             }
01350 
01351             /* some hair paths might be non-existent so they can't be used for duplication */
01352             if (hair &&
01353                 ((a < totpart && psys->pathcache[a]->steps < 0) ||
01354                 (a >= totpart && psys->childcache[a-totpart]->steps < 0)))
01355                 continue;
01356 
01357             if (part->ren_as==PART_DRAW_GR) {
01358                 /* prevent divide by zero below [#28336] */
01359                 if (totgroup == 0)
01360                     continue;
01361 
01362                 /* for groups, pick the object based on settings */
01363                 if (part->draw&PART_DRAW_RAND_GR)
01364                     b= BLI_rand() % totgroup;
01365                 else
01366                     b= a % totgroup;
01367 
01368                 ob = oblist[b];
01369                 obmat = oblist[b]->obmat;
01370                 oldobmat = obcopylist[b].obmat;
01371             }
01372             else {
01373                 obmat= ob->obmat;
01374                 oldobmat= obcopy.obmat;
01375             }
01376 
01377             if (hair) {
01378                 /* hair we handle separate and compute transform based on hair keys */
01379                 if (a < totpart) {
01380                     cache = psys->pathcache[a];
01381                     psys_get_dupli_path_transform(&sim, pa, NULL, cache, pamat, &scale);
01382                 }
01383                 else {
01384                     cache = psys->childcache[a-totpart];
01385                     psys_get_dupli_path_transform(&sim, NULL, cpa, cache, pamat, &scale);
01386                 }
01387 
01388                 copy_v3_v3(pamat[3], cache->co);
01389                 pamat[3][3]= 1.0f;
01390                 
01391             }
01392             else {
01393                 /* first key */
01394                 state.time = ctime;
01395                 if (psys_get_particle_state(&sim, a, &state, 0) == 0) {
01396                     continue;
01397                 }
01398                 else {
01399                     float tquat[4];
01400                     normalize_qt_qt(tquat, state.rot);
01401                     quat_to_mat4(pamat, tquat);
01402                     copy_v3_v3(pamat[3], state.co);
01403                     pamat[3][3]= 1.0f;
01404                 }
01405             }
01406 
01407             if (part->ren_as==PART_DRAW_GR && psys->part->draw & PART_DRAW_WHOLE_GR) {
01408                 for (go= part->dup_group->gobject.first, b=0; go; go= go->next, b++) {
01409 
01410                     copy_m4_m4(tmat, oblist[b]->obmat);
01411                     /* apply particle scale */
01412                     mul_mat3_m4_fl(tmat, size*scale);
01413                     mul_v3_fl(tmat[3], size*scale);
01414                     /* group dupli offset, should apply after everything else */
01415                     if (!is_zero_v3(part->dup_group->dupli_ofs))
01416                         sub_v3_v3v3(tmat[3], tmat[3], part->dup_group->dupli_ofs);
01417                     /* individual particle transform */
01418                     mult_m4_m4m4(tmat, pamat, tmat);
01419 
01420                     if (par_space_mat)
01421                         mult_m4_m4m4(mat, par_space_mat, tmat);
01422                     else
01423                         copy_m4_m4(mat, tmat);
01424 
01425                     dob= new_dupli_object(lb, go->ob, mat, par->lay, counter, OB_DUPLIPARTS, animated);
01426                     copy_m4_m4(dob->omat, obcopylist[b].obmat);
01427                     if (G.rendering)
01428                         psys_get_dupli_texture(psys, part, sim.psmd, pa, cpa, dob->uv, dob->orco);
01429                 }
01430             }
01431             else {
01432                 /* to give ipos in object correct offset */
01433                 where_is_object_time(scene, ob, ctime-pa_time);
01434 
01435                 copy_v3_v3(vec, obmat[3]);
01436                 obmat[3][0] = obmat[3][1] = obmat[3][2] = 0.0f;
01437 
01438                 /* particle rotation uses x-axis as the aligned axis, so pre-rotate the object accordingly */
01439                 if ((part->draw & PART_DRAW_ROTATE_OB) == 0) {
01440                     float xvec[3], q[4];
01441                     xvec[0] = -1.f;
01442                     xvec[1] = xvec[2] = 0;
01443                     vec_to_quat(q, xvec, ob->trackflag, ob->upflag);
01444                     quat_to_mat4(obmat, q);
01445                     obmat[3][3]= 1.0f;
01446                 }
01447                 
01448                 /* Normal particles and cached hair live in global space so we need to
01449                  * remove the real emitter's transformation before 2nd order duplication.
01450                  */
01451                 if (par_space_mat && GS(id->name) != ID_GR)
01452                     mult_m4_m4m4(mat, psys->imat, pamat);
01453                 else
01454                     copy_m4_m4(mat, pamat);
01455 
01456                 mult_m4_m4m4(tmat, mat, obmat);
01457                 mul_mat3_m4_fl(tmat, size*scale);
01458 
01459                 if (par_space_mat)
01460                     mult_m4_m4m4(mat, par_space_mat, tmat);
01461                 else
01462                     copy_m4_m4(mat, tmat);
01463 
01464                 if (part->draw & PART_DRAW_GLOBAL_OB)
01465                     add_v3_v3v3(mat[3], mat[3], vec);
01466 
01467                 dob= new_dupli_object(lb, ob, mat, ob->lay, counter, GS(id->name) == ID_GR ? OB_DUPLIGROUP : OB_DUPLIPARTS, animated);
01468                 copy_m4_m4(dob->omat, oldobmat);
01469                 if (G.rendering)
01470                     psys_get_dupli_texture(psys, part, sim.psmd, pa, cpa, dob->uv, dob->orco);
01471             }
01472         }
01473 
01474         /* restore objects since they were changed in where_is_object_time */
01475         if (part->ren_as==PART_DRAW_GR) {
01476             for (a=0; a<totgroup; a++)
01477                 *(oblist[a])= obcopylist[a];
01478         }
01479         else
01480             *ob= obcopy;
01481     }
01482 
01483     /* clean up */
01484     if (oblist)
01485         MEM_freeN(oblist);
01486     if (obcopylist)
01487         MEM_freeN(obcopylist);
01488 
01489     if (psys->lattice) {
01490         end_latt_deform(psys->lattice);
01491         psys->lattice = NULL;
01492     }
01493 }
01494 
01495 static Object *find_family_object(Object **obar, char *family, char ch)
01496 {
01497     Object *ob;
01498     int flen;
01499     
01500     if ( obar[(int)ch] ) return obar[(int)ch];
01501     
01502     flen= strlen(family);
01503     
01504     ob= G.main->object.first;
01505     while (ob) {
01506         if ( ob->id.name[flen+2]==ch ) {
01507             if ( strncmp(ob->id.name+2, family, flen)==0 ) break;
01508         }
01509         ob= ob->id.next;
01510     }
01511     
01512     obar[(int)ch]= ob;
01513     
01514     return ob;
01515 }
01516 
01517 
01518 static void font_duplilist(ListBase *lb, Scene *scene, Object *par, int level, int animated)
01519 {
01520     Object *ob, *obar[256]= {NULL};
01521     Curve *cu;
01522     struct chartrans *ct, *chartransdata;
01523     float vec[3], obmat[4][4], pmat[4][4], fsize, xof, yof;
01524     int slen, a;
01525     
01526     /* simple preventing of too deep nested groups */
01527     if (level>MAX_DUPLI_RECUR) return;
01528     
01529     copy_m4_m4(pmat, par->obmat);
01530     
01531     /* in par the family name is stored, use this to find the other objects */
01532     
01533     chartransdata= BKE_text_to_curve(G.main, scene, par, FO_DUPLI);
01534     if (chartransdata==NULL) return;
01535 
01536     cu= par->data;
01537     slen= strlen(cu->str);
01538     fsize= cu->fsize;
01539     xof= cu->xof;
01540     yof= cu->yof;
01541     
01542     ct= chartransdata;
01543     
01544     for (a=0; a<slen; a++, ct++) {
01545         
01546         ob= find_family_object(obar, cu->family, cu->str[a]);
01547         if (ob) {
01548             vec[0]= fsize*(ct->xof - xof);
01549             vec[1]= fsize*(ct->yof - yof);
01550             vec[2]= 0.0;
01551             
01552             mul_m4_v3(pmat, vec);
01553             
01554             copy_m4_m4(obmat, par->obmat);
01555             copy_v3_v3(obmat[3], vec);
01556             
01557             new_dupli_object(lb, ob, obmat, par->lay, a, OB_DUPLIVERTS, animated);
01558         }
01559     }
01560     
01561     MEM_freeN(chartransdata);
01562 }
01563 
01564 /* ------------- */
01565 
01566 static void object_duplilist_recursive(ID *id, Scene *scene, Object *ob, ListBase *duplilist, float par_space_mat[][4], int level, int animated)
01567 {   
01568     if ((ob->transflag & OB_DUPLI)==0)
01569         return;
01570     
01571     /* Should the dupli's be generated for this object? - Respect restrict flags */
01572     if (G.rendering) {
01573         if (ob->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_RENDER) {
01574             return;
01575         }
01576     }
01577     else {
01578         if (ob->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_VIEW) {
01579             return;
01580         }
01581     }
01582 
01583     if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLIPARTS) {
01584         ParticleSystem *psys = ob->particlesystem.first;
01585         for (; psys; psys=psys->next)
01586             new_particle_duplilist(duplilist, id, scene, ob, par_space_mat, psys, level+1, animated);
01587     }
01588     else if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLIVERTS) {
01589         if (ob->type==OB_MESH) {
01590             vertex_duplilist(duplilist, id, scene, ob, par_space_mat, level+1, animated);
01591         }
01592         else if (ob->type==OB_FONT) {
01593             if (GS(id->name)==ID_SCE) { /* TODO - support dupligroups */
01594                 font_duplilist(duplilist, scene, ob, level+1, animated);
01595             }
01596         }
01597     }
01598     else if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLIFACES) {
01599         if (ob->type==OB_MESH)
01600             face_duplilist(duplilist, id, scene, ob, par_space_mat, level+1, animated);
01601     }
01602     else if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLIFRAMES) {
01603         if (GS(id->name)==ID_SCE) { /* TODO - support dupligroups */
01604             frames_duplilist(duplilist, scene, ob, level+1, animated);
01605         }
01606     }
01607     else if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLIGROUP) {
01608         DupliObject *dob;
01609         
01610         group_duplilist(duplilist, scene, ob, level+1, animated); /* now recursive */
01611 
01612         if (level==0) {
01613             for (dob= duplilist->first; dob; dob= dob->next)
01614                 if (dob->type == OB_DUPLIGROUP)
01615                     copy_m4_m4(dob->ob->obmat, dob->mat);
01616         }
01617     }
01618 }
01619 
01620 /* Returns a list of DupliObject
01621  * note; group dupli's already set transform matrix. see note in group_duplilist() */
01622 ListBase *object_duplilist(Scene *sce, Object *ob)
01623 {
01624     ListBase *duplilist= MEM_mallocN(sizeof(ListBase), "duplilist");
01625     duplilist->first= duplilist->last= NULL;
01626     object_duplilist_recursive((ID *)sce, sce, ob, duplilist, NULL, 0, 0);
01627     return duplilist;
01628 }
01629 
01630 void free_object_duplilist(ListBase *lb)
01631 {
01632     DupliObject *dob;
01633     
01634     /* loop in reverse order, if object is instanced multiple times
01635      * the original layer may not really be original otherwise, proper
01636      * solution is more complicated */
01637     for (dob= lb->last; dob; dob= dob->prev) {
01638         dob->ob->lay= dob->origlay;
01639         copy_m4_m4(dob->ob->obmat, dob->omat);
01640     }
01641     
01642     BLI_freelistN(lb);
01643     MEM_freeN(lb);
01644 }
01645 
01646 int count_duplilist(Object *ob)
01647 {
01648     if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLI) {
01649         if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLIVERTS) {
01650             if (ob->type==OB_MESH) {
01651                 if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLIVERTS) {
01652                     ParticleSystem *psys = ob->particlesystem.first;
01653                     int pdup=0;
01654 
01655                     for (; psys; psys=psys->next)
01656                         pdup += psys->totpart;
01657 
01658                     if (pdup==0) {
01659                         Mesh *me= ob->data;
01660                         return me->totvert;
01661                     }
01662                     else
01663                         return pdup;
01664                 }
01665             }
01666         }
01667         else if (ob->transflag & OB_DUPLIFRAMES) {
01668             int tot= ob->dupend - ob->dupsta; 
01669             tot/= (ob->dupon+ob->dupoff);
01670             return tot*ob->dupon;
01671         }
01672     }
01673     return 1;
01674 }
